title: ACT Today! Autism Care Grant
eligibility: Families of children with autism. Priority given to households with income under $100,000. Funding covers ABA, speech therapy, OT, medications, and home safety devices.
summary: ACT Today! provides quarterly grants up to $5,000 to help families access autism-related therapies including speech, OT, and ABA that they otherwise could not afford.

title: UHCCF Medical Grant for Children
eligibility: Families with children who need health-related services not covered or not fully covered by commercial health insurance. Up to $5,000/year per child ($10,000 lifetime max). Do NOT need UnitedHealthcare insurance.
summary: UHCCF provides grants to help children access medical services including speech therapy, occupational therapy, and physical therapy not fully covered by insurance.

title: Orange Effect Speech Therapy Grant
eligibility: Children and adults who need speech therapy or communication devices. Must demonstrate financial need. Funds go directly to the service provider.
summary: The Orange Effect Foundation funds speech therapy sessions and communication technology (AAC devices) for individuals who cannot afford them.

title: Small Steps in Speech Therapy Grant
eligibility: Families with children who need speech therapy services. Must demonstrate financial need.
summary: Provides grants specifically for speech therapy and communication needs for children whose families face financial barriers to accessing care.

title: Autism Care Today Quarterly Assistance
eligibility: Families of children diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder. Funds are paid directly to the child's service provider.
summary: Provides quarterly financial assistance by directly paying a child's therapy provider for ABA, speech, OT, and other autism-related services families couldn't otherwise afford.

title: Maggie Welby Family Grant
eligibility: Children and families with financial need for medical, therapeutic, athletic, or educational opportunities.
summary: Offers grants for children and families that have a financial need, including therapy services, medical needs, adaptive equipment, and opportunities a child would not otherwise have.

title: Special Angels Foundation Grant
eligibility: Children with special needs requiring therapy, equipment, or medical services not covered by insurance.
summary: Provides grants for children with special needs including therapy services, adaptive equipment, and medical support that insurance does not cover.

title: Variety Children's Grant
eligibility: Children with special needs through age 21. Up to $5,000/year with a $10,000 lifetime max. State chapters across the US.
summary: Empowers children with special needs by funding therapy, adaptive equipment, and mobility devices. Has state chapters across the US with local grant programs.

title: SupportNow Therapy Grant Directory
eligibility: Families seeking therapy funding. SupportNow provides a curated directory of active grants plus a free Fundraising Consultant.
summary: A comprehensive, regularly updated directory of active therapy grant programs across the US. Includes a free Fundraising Consultant to help families navigate applications.
